moves.1. e4 e5: I'm not much of an e5 player, but I chose to play it because I was hoping for a real Morphy King's Gambit game.
moves.2. d4 exd4 3. c3: Danish Gambit, I rather like white's chances after the two pawn sacrifice so i'll decline.
moves.3... Qe7: I debated between the Sörensen Defense immediately (d5), but I decided to see my opponents reaction to Qe7.
moves.4. Bd3: An attempt to solve the e4 pawn, but instead later it allows me access for a decent post in his territory.
moves.4... d5 5. Qa4+ Nc6 6. Ne2 dxe4 7. Bb5 B: The whole time i was expecting a cxd4...poor b1 knight never got to participate much
moves.9... Bb5: Preventing the imminent castle at least for the moment
moves.10. Be3: I'm still unsure of this move, perhaps just for a development and for a battery?
moves.10... c5: Destroying hte battery and launching a counter offensive
moves.13. Re1: Support to the knight; frees the queen
moves.13... O-O-O: More support to the knight and also an indirect attack to the queen.
moves.14. Qa4 Qd7: I figured I had decent position and I was welcome to the trade; however, my opponent fell for the trap....
moves.15... Bxe2: losing the knight. Rxe2 and Qc1
moves.16. Nd2 Qb5: Support to the bishop and also attacking the b2 pawn
moves.17. c4 Qxb2: Here I looked into the position a little bit deeper and decided this was still in my best interest even after
moves.18. Rab1: My queen will be traded out or I lose my bishop entirely
moves.18... Rxd2 19. Bxd2: I was rather surprised at this move, I assumed he'd take the queen, but instead he tried to launch an attack at my weak base.
moves.19... Qxd2: There was no immediate checkmates and I figured he could chase me around and I could end to safety at g6 if needed
moves.22... Rf8: everything seems well protected and no chances for me losing yet, so back to my offensive
moves.23. a4: I guess my opponent decided we were in a sort of drawish position and figured he could push his a pawn without resistance
moves.23... Nd7: Perhaps I could've made another move, but at the time I didn't account for Qb2 which halts my attack
moves.24. a5 Bd3 25. Qb2: There's the Qb2...i get an extra pawn and let the trade occur
moves.25... Rxf2 26. Qxd2 Rxd2 27. Rbd1: Tough position, perhaps better to not have traded rooks, but still I should be able to take the game with relative ease
moves.27... Rxd1 28. Rxd1: He too decides it's too hard to continue.
